tool.name: MassTraceExtractor
tool.description: Detects mass traces in centroided LC-MS data.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${out_type}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: input centroided mzML file

param.name: out_type
param.label: output file type -- default: determined from file extension or content

param.name: noise_threshold_int
param.label: Intensity threshold below which peaks are regarded as noise

param.name: chrom_peak_snr
param.label: Minimum signal-to-noise a mass trace should have

param.name: chrom_fwhm
param.label: Expected chromatographic peak width (in seconds)

param.name: mass_error_ppm
param.label: Allowed mass deviation (in ppm)

param.name: reestimate_mt_sd
param.label: Enables dynamic re-estimation of m/z variance during mass trace collection stage

param.name: quant_method
param.label: Method of quantification for mass traces
param.help: For LC data 'area' is recommended, 'median' for direct injection data. 'max_height' simply uses the most intense peak in the trace

param.name: trace_termination_criterion
param.label: Termination criterion for the extension of mass traces
param.help: In 'outlier' mode, trace extension cancels if a predefined number of consecutive outliers are found (see trace_termination_outliers parameter). In 'sample_rate' mode, trace extension in both directions stops if ratio of found peaks versus visited spectra falls below the 'min_sample_rate' threshold

param.name: trace_termination_outliers
param.label: Mass trace extension in one direction cancels if this number of consecutive spectra with no detectable peaks is reached

param.name: min_sample_rate
param.label: Minimum fraction of scans along the mass trace that must contain a peak

param.name: min_trace_length
param.label: Minimum expected length of a mass trace (in seconds)

param.name: max_trace_length
param.label: Maximum expected length of a mass trace (in seconds)
param.help: Set to a negative value to disable maximal length check during mass trace detection

param.name: width_filtering
param.label: Enable filtering of unlikely peak widths
param.help: The fixed setting filters out mass traces outside the [min_fwhm, max_fwhm] interval (set parameters accordingly!). The auto setting filters with the 5 and 95% quantiles of the peak width distribution

param.name: min_fwhm
param.label: Minimum full-width-at-half-maximum of chromatographic peaks (in seconds)
param.help: Ignored if parameter width_filtering is off or auto

param.name: max_fwhm
param.label: Maximum full-width-at-half-maximum of chromatographic peaks (in seconds)
param.help: Ignored if parameter width_filtering is off or auto

param.name: masstrace_snr_filtering
param.label: Apply post-filtering by signal-to-noise ratio after smoothing

param.name: enabled
param.label: Enables/disables the chromatographic peak detection of mass traces

param.name: force
param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Detects mass traces in centroided LC-MS data.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/TOPP_MassTraceExtractor.html
